x_l: A study of the human microbiome published online in Nature last month has offered more details on how the "microbial world" -- a term used to describe all the bacteria, viruses and fungi living in and on the human body -- functions. Researchers studied the gut microbes of a group of obese humans and then transplanted them into germ-free mice, which resulted in a 60 percent decrease in weight. The gut microbes of normal mice could not be transplanted. The researchers theorize that this is because the human gut, unlike the mouse gut, is filled with trillions of microbes.
